note.p: Education: Schools at Colchester and Bury St Edmunds; St John's College, Cambridge (admitted 1740); Gray's Inn (admitted 1741)
Career: Called to the Bar (1746); Bencher (1751); Prothonotary of the Court of Common pleas (1757); Treasurer (1761); Justice of the Peace for Middlesex and Essex; Governor, Hudson Bay Company (1783)
References: R I Ruggles, 'Governor Samuel Wegg, Intelligent Layman of the Royal Society, 1753-1802' in NR 1977-8 vol 32 pp 181-199, plate
